Speaker: big cop
Dialogue: Get your hands behind your head!

Speaker: big cop
Dialogue: Hands behind your head!  Now!  Do it!

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: I'm just doing my job.  You gimme that Juris-my dick-tion and you can cran it up your ass.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: The orders were for your protection.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: I think we can handle one little girl.

Speaker: lieutenant
Dialogue: I sent two units.  They're bringing her down now.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: No, Lieutenant, your men are dead.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Morpheus!  The link was traced!  I don't know how.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Get up, Trinity.  You're fine. Get up -- just get up!

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Did you get anything from the room?

Speaker: agent jones
Dialogue: Their next target.  The name is Neo.

Speaker: screen
Dialogue: JACKON:  I heard Morpheus has been on this board. SUPERASTIC:  Morpheus doesn't even exist and the Matrix is nothing but an advertising gimmick 4 a new game. TIMAXE:  All I want to know is Trinity really a girl? LODIII:  87% of all women on line are really men. QUARK:  The Matrix is a euphemism for the government. SUPERASTIC:  No, The Matrix is the system controlling our lives. TIMAXE:  You mean MTV. SUPERASTIC:  I mean Sega. FOS4:  ALL HAIL SEGA!!!

Speaker: screen
Dialogue: Do you want to know what the Matrix is, Neo?

Speaker: screen
Dialogue: SUPERASTIC:  Who said that? JACKON:  Who's Neo? GIBSON:  This is a private board.

Speaker: screen
Dialogue: TIMAXE:  Someone is hacking the hackers! FOS4:  It's Morpheus!!!!! JACKON:  Identify yourself.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: I need your help, man.  Desperate. They got me, man.  The shackles of fascism.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: You got the money this time?

Speaker: dujour
Dialogue: You can really get that thing off, right now?

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: I told you, honey, he may look like just another geek but this here is all we got left standing between Big Brother and the New World Order.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Look at 'em.  Automatons.  Don't think about what they're- doing or why.  Computer tells 'em what to do and they do it.

Speaker: dujour
Dialogue: Why don't you come to the party with us?

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: I don't know.  I have to work tomorrow.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: I know a lot about you.  I've been wanting to meet you for some time.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Trinity?  The Trinity?  The Trinity that cracked the I.R.S. Kansas City D-Base?

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: That was a long time ago.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: I just thought... you were a guy.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Do you want to go sorewhere and talk?

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: No.  It's safe here and I don't have much time.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: That was you on the board tonight. That was your note, wasn't it?

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: I had to gamble that you would see and they wouldn't.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: I can't explain everything to you. I'm sure that it's all going to seem very strange, but I brought you here to warn you, Neo.  You are in a lot of danger.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: They're watching you.  Something happened and they found out about you.  Normally, if our target is exposed we let it go.  But this time, we can't do that.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: You came here because you wanted to know the answer to a hacker's question.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: The Matrix.  What is the Matrix?

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Twelve years ago I met a man, a great man, who said that no one could be told the answer to that question.  That they had to see it, to believe it.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: He told me that no one should look for the answer unless they have to because once you see it, everything changes.  Your life and the world you live in will never be the same.  It's as if you wake up one morning and the sky is falling.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: The truth is out there, Neo.  It's looking for you and it will find you, if you want it to.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: That's all I can tell you right now.  Good-bye, Neo.  And good luck.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Wait.  Who was it?  Who was the man?

Speaker: rhineheart
Dialogue: You have a problem, Mr. Anderson. You think that you're special. You believe that somehow the rules do not apply to you.

Speaker: rhineheart
Dialogue: This company is one of the top software companies in the world because every single employee understands that they are a part of a whole.  Thus, if an employee has a problem, the company has a problem.

Speaker: rhineheart
Dialogue: The time has come to make a choice, Mr. Anderson.  Either you choose to be at your desk on time from this day forth, or you choose to find yourself another job.  Do I make myself clear?

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: If I was late again, I'm going to be fired.

Speaker: tall employee
Dialogue: Well, it was nice working with you.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: What the fuck do they want with me?!

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: How do you know all this?

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: No way, no way, this is crazy.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: This is insane!  Why is this happening to me?  What did I do? I'm nobody.  I didn't do anything. Fuck! Fuck!  Fuck!

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: This is insane.  I can't do this! Forget it!

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: As you can see, we've had our eye on you for some time now, Mr. Anderson.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: It seems that you have been living two lives.  In one life, you are Thomas A. Anderson, program writer for a respectable software company.  You have a social security number, you pay your taxes and you help your land lady carry out her garbage.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: The other life is lived in computers where you go by the hacker alias Neo, and are guilty of virtually every computer crime we have a law for, including the unauthorized use of the D.M.V. system for the removal of automobile boots.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: One of these,lives has a future. One of them does not.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: I'm going to be as forthcoming as I can be, Mr. Anderson.  You are here because we need your help.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: We know that you have been contacted by a certain individual. A man who calls himself Morpheus. Whatever you think you know about this man is irrelevant to the fact that he is wanted for acts of terrorism in more countries than any other man in the world.  He is considered by many authorities to be the most dangerous man alive.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: My colleagues believe that I am wasting my time with you, but I believe you want to do the right thing.  It is obvious that you are an intelligent man, Mr. Anderson, and that you are interested in the future.  That is why I believe you are ready to put your past mistakes behind you and get on with your life.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: We are willing to wipe the slate clean, to give you a fresh start and all we are asking in return is your cooperation in bringing a known terrorist to justice.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Yeah.  Wow.  That sounds like a real good deal.  But I think I have a better one.  How about I give you the finger --

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: And you can cram that file up your Secret Service sphincter.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: The irony of your situation is that you have no choice.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: You can't scare me with this gestapo crap.  I know my rights. I want my phone call.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: And tell me, Mr. Anderson, what good is a phone call iy you are unable to speak?

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: You are going to help us, Mr. Anderson, whether you want to or not.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: We got him.  Call the chop-shop.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Listen to me, Neo.  You have to, trust us.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: This has to be done for your protection and ours.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: You can't understand right now, but if you're not one of us, you're one of them.

Speaker: gizmo
Dialogue: Va va va voom.  Still the hottest software around.

Speaker: gizmo
Dialogue: This is really the guy?  The guy that Morpheus thinks --

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Are you going to help us or aren't you?

Speaker: gizmo
Dialogue: Hacksaw.  Load up the copper-top and let's get the hell outta here.

Speaker: gizmo
Dialogue: Okay, first we take a little look under the hood.

Speaker: gizmo
Dialogue: You're going to feel a little prick.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: We think you're bugged.  We can't take you to Morpheus until you're clean.

Speaker: gizmo
Dialogue: Hit him with 10 ccs of local.

Speaker: gizmo
Dialogue: I don't know.  They've never done that before.

Speaker: gizmo
Dialogue: I got it!  Maybe we can stun it.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Are you crazy?  That will kill him.

Speaker: gizmo
Dialogue: It'll work.  Come on, do it or Hacksaw will.

Speaker: gizmo
Dialogue: I just hope the man knows what he's doing.

Speaker: gizmo
Dialogue: Goddamn, what I wouldn't give for a copy of that software.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Gizmo, you don't have the hardware to handle this software.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Let me give one piece of advice. Be honest.  He knows more than you can possibly imagine.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Welcome, Neo.  As you no doubt have guessed, I am Morpheus.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: I imagine, right now, you must be feeling a bit like Alice, tumbling down the rabbit hole?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: I can see it in your eyes.  You have the look of a man who accepts what he sees because he is expecting to wake up.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Ironically, this is not far from the truth.  But I'm getting ahead of myself.  Can you tell me, Neo, why are you here?

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: You're Morpheus, you're a legend. Most hackers would die to meet you.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Yes.  Thank you.  But I think we both know there's more to it than that.  Do you believe in fate, Neo?

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Because I don't like the idea that I'm not in control of my life.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: I know exactly what you mean.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Let me tell you why you are here. You are here because you have the gift.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: I've watched you, Neo.  You do not use a computer like a tool.  You use it like it was part of yourself.  What you can do inside a computer is not normal.  I know. I've seen it.  What you do is magic.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: But it is, Neo.  It is.  How else would you describe what has been happening to you?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: We are trained in this world to accept only what is rational and logical.  Have you ever wondered why?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: As children, we do not separate the possible from the impossible which is why the younger a mind is the easier it is to free while a mind like yours can be very difficult.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Do you want to know what it is, Neo?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: It's that feeling you have had all your life.  That feeling that something was wrong with the world.  You don't know what it is but it's there, like a splinter in your mind, driving you mad, driving you to me.  But what is it?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: The Matrix is everywhere, it's all around us, here even in this room. You can see it out your window, or on your television.  You feel it when you go to work, or go to church or pay your taxes.  It is the world that has been pulled over your eyes to blind you from the truth.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: That you are a slave, Neo.  That you, like everyone else, was born into bondage... ... kept inside a prison that you cannot smell, taste, or touch.  A prison for your mind.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Unfortunately, no one can be told what the Matrix is.  You have to see it for yourself.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: This is your last chance.  After this, there is no going back.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: You take the blue pill and the story ends.  You wake in your bed and you believe whatever you want to believe.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: You take the red pill and you stay in Wonderland and I show you how deep the rabbit-hole goes.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Remember that all I am offering is the truth.  Nothing more.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: Morpheus, I know what you believe but I think this is a mistake. We're rushing him.  He's old.  I'm afraid he might pop.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Haven't I always told you, Cypher, not to let fear control your life. Apoc, are we on-line?

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Apoc?  You wrote the Four Horsemen Virus.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Neo, time is always against us. Will you take a seat there?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: I imagine you know sonething about virtual reality.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Essentially, it's a hardware system that uses an apparatus; headgear, gloves and whatever to make you feel that you are in a computer program.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: If the virtual reality apparatus, as you called it, was wired to all of your senses and controlled them completely, would you be able to tell the difference between the virtual world and the real world?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: The pill you took is part of a trace program.  It's going to make things feel a bit strange.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Tank, we're going to need the signal soon.  Stay calm, Neo.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: I knew it, I knew it...

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Welcome to the real world, Neo.

Speaker: dozer
Dialogue: He needs a lot of work.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Your muscles have atrophied. We're rebuilding them.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Rest, Neo.  The answers are coming.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Morpheus, what's happened to me? What is this place?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: More important than what is when?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: You believe the year is 1997 when in fact it is much closer to 2197. I can't say for certain what year it is because we honestly do not know.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: I promised you the truth, Neo, and the truth is that the world you were living in was a lie.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: This is my ship, the Nebuchadnezzar.  It's a hovercraft.  Small like a submarine.  It's dark.  It's cramped and cold.  But it's home.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: This is the main deck.  You know most of my crew.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: The ones you don't know.  That's Mouse and Switch.  The two big guys are Tank and Dozer.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: And this, this is the Core.  This is where we broadcast our pirate signal and hack into the Matrix.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Do you remember when I asked you about an apparatus that could turn a virtual reality into reality?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: This will feel a little weird.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: It is our loading program.  We can load anything from clothes, to weapons, to training simulations. Anything we need.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Right now, we're inside a computer program?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: What is real?  How do you define real?  If you're talking about your senses, what you feel, taste, smell, or see, then all you're talking about are electrical signals interpreted by your brain.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: This is the Chicago you know. Chicago as it was at the end of the twentieth century.  This Chicago exists only as part of a neural-interactive simulation that we call the Matrix.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: You have been living inside Baulliaurd's vision, inside the map, not the territory.  This is Chicago as it exists today.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: We are, right now, miles below the earth's surface.  The only place humans can survive outside the Matrix is underground.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: It started early in the twenty- first century, with the birth of artificial intelligence, a singular consciousness that spawned an entire race of machines.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: At first all they wanted was to be treated as equals, entitled to the same human inalienable rights. Whatever they were given, it was not enough.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: We don't know who struck first. Us or them.  But sometime at the end of the twenty-first century the battle was joined.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: The war raged for generations and turned the face of our planet from green and blue to black and red.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: It scorched and burned the sky. Without the sun, the machines sought out a new energy source to survive.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: They discovered a new form of fusion.  All that was required to initiate the reaction was a small electric charge.  Throughout human history we have been dependent on machines to survive.  Fate, it seems, is not without a sense of irony.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: The human body generates more bio- electricity than a 120-volt battery and over 25,000 B.T.U.'s of body heat.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: We are, as an energy source, easily renewable and completely recyclable, the dead liquified and fed intravenously to the living.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: All they needed to control this new battery was something to occupy our mind.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: And so they built a prison out of our past, wired it to our brains and turned us into slaves.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: No!  I don't believe it!  It's not possible!

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: I didn't say that it would be easy, Neo.  I just said that it would be the truth.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Stop!  Let me out!  I want out!

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Get this thing out of me!

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Don't touch me!  Get away from me!

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: I can't go back, can I?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: No.  But if you could, would you really want to?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: I feel that I owe you an apology. There is a rule that we do not free a mind once it reaches a certain age.  It is dangerous. They have trouble letting go.. Their mind turns against them. I've seen it happen.  I broke the rule because I had to.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: When the Matrix was first built there was a man born inside that had the ability to change what he wanted, to remake the Matrix as he saw fit.  It was this man that freed the first of us and taught us the secret of the war; control the Matrix and you control the future.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: When he died, the Oracle at the temple of Zion prophesied his return and envisioned an end to the war and freedom for our people.  That is why there are those of us that have spent our entire lives searching the Matrix, looking for him.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: I did what I did, because I believe we have been brought here for a reason, Neo.  You are here to serve a purpose, just as I am here to serve mine.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: I told you I don't believe in fate.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: But I do, Neo.  I do.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Get some rest.  You're going to need it.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: You will tonight.  I guarantee it. I'm Tank.  I'll be your operator.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: Any holes?  Nope.  Me and my brother Dozer, we are 100 percent pure, old fashioned, home-grown human.  Born free.  Right here in the real world.  Genuine child of Zion.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: Zion is the place, man.  You'll see it one day.  Last human city. All we got left.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: Goddamn, I got to tell you I'm fairly excited to see what you are capable of.  I mean if Morpheus is right and all.  We're not supposed to talk.about any of that, but if you are, well then this is an exciting time.  We got a lot to do so let's get to it.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: We're supposed to load all these operations programs first, but this is some major boring shit. Why don't we start something a little fun?

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Jiujitsu?  I'm going to learn jujitsu?

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: Hey, Mikey, he likes it!  Ready for more?

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: Ten hours straight.  He's a machine.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: This is incredible.  I know Kung Fu.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: This is a sparring program, similar to the programmed reality of the Matrix.  Consider this your first lesson.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Good.  Adaption.  Improvisation. But your weakness isn't your technique.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Do you think my being faster, stronger has anything to do with my muscles in this place?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Do you believe that's air you are breathing now?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: If you can free your mind, the body will follow.

Speaker: cable
Dialogue: Jeezus Keerist!  That boy is fast!

Speaker: mouse
Dialogue: You ever seen anyone that fast that soon, Tank?

Speaker: apoc
Dialogue: Morpheus is right.  He's got to be the one.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Good, good.  Anger is a gift, Neo, but it's a heavy one.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: You have to learn to let go of that anger.  You must let go of everything.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: You must empty yourself to free your mind.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Yeah.  Free my mind.  Right.  No problem.

Speaker: mouse
Dialogue: No one's ever made their first jump.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: If you never know failure, how can you know success?

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: If you are killed in the Matrix, you die here?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: The body cannot live without the mind.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Neo, I saved you some dinner --

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: Whoa!  Shit, Neo, you scared the bejeezus out of ne.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: I'll tell you, I feel for you, man.  I really do.  Most of us were still young, just punks, when Morpheus jacked us.  But you, you had a real life.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: Good shit, huh?  Dozer makes it. It's good for two things: degreasing engines and killing brain cells.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: Did he tell you why he did it?

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: Let me give you a piece of advice. Between you and me, if Morpheus says you can fly, I wouldn't go jumping out any windows to find out if he's right.  Understand?

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: That's what he said to me nine years ago.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: The real world.  Ha, what a joke.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: You know what real is?  I'll tell you what real is.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: Real is just another four-letter word.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Do we have a deal, Mr. Reagan?

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: You know, I know that this steak doesn't exist.  I know when I put it in my mouth, the Matrix is telling my brain that it is juicy and delicious.  After nine years, do you know what I've realized?

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: I don't want to remember nothing. Nothing!  You understand?  And I want to be rich.  Someone important.  Like an actor.  You can do that, right?

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: All right.  You get my body back in a power plant, reinsert me into the Matrix and I'll get you what you want.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: I told you, I don't know them. But I can give you the man who does.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Jeez, I was wondering about that.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Why I was bald here but not in the Matrix.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Main power supply to the core.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Mainframe self-destruct.  Uses all remaining power to generate an... E.M.P?

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: Electromagnetic pulse.  Our best weapon against the machines.  The problem is if someone is still in the Matrix when that thing goes off, they're not coming back.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: We just finished the operation programs and he's showing great retention.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Good.  I want everyone alerted to 12-hour stand-by.  We're going in. Neo, it's time for you to know why you're here.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: He's taking you into the Matrix to see her.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Mouse and Cable hold the exit. Let's go.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Did you have to do this?

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: There's no point in worrylng. Whatever is going to happen is going to happen.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: We should be back in an hour.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Do you now understand what it means when we say, if you're not one of us, you're one of them?

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: The agents.  They're sentient programs.  They can commandeer any software hardwired to the mainframe.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Anyone that is still in a power plant.  That is why we try to be invisible in the Matrix.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: The best hacking is always traceless.

Speaker: mojo
Dialogue: Morpheus, been a long time coming.

Speaker: mojo
Dialogue: You bringing us geriatrics now. Morpheus?

Speaker: mojo
Dialogue: Guess you are locking for a miracle.

Speaker: mojo
Dialogue: All right, it's cool.  Go on back.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: This is the temple.  It is a part of Zion's mainframe.  It's hidden inside the Matrix so that we can access it.

Speaker: priestess
Dialogue: Hello, Morpheus.  We've been expecting you.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Okay, you're on your own.  Go with them.

Speaker: priestess
Dialogue: Wait here.  Among the other Potentials.

Speaker: spoon boy
Dialogue: Your spoon does not bend because it is just that, a spoon.  Mine bends because there is no spoon, just my mind.

Speaker: spoon boy
Dialogue: Link yourself to the spoon. Become the spoon and bend yourself.

Speaker: priestess
Dialogue: The Oracle will see you now.

Speaker: oracle
Dialogue: Bingo.  I got to say I love seeing you non-believers.  It's really a relief.  All that pomp and circumstances just plain tucker me out.  Almost done.  Smell good, don't they?

Speaker: oracle
Dialogue: I'd ask you to sit down, but you're not going to anyway.  And don't worry about the vase.

Speaker: oracle
Dialogue: I said don't worry about it.  I'll get one of my kids to fix it.

Speaker: oracle
Dialogue: What's really going to bake your noodle later on is, would you still have broken it if I hadn't said anything.

Speaker: oracle
Dialogue: You're cuter than I thought.  I see why she likes you.

Speaker: oracle
Dialogue: You know why Morpheus brought you to see me?

Speaker: oracle
Dialogue: So? What do you think?  You think you're the one?

Speaker: oracle
Dialogue: You know what that means?  It's Latin.  Means, 'Know thyself.'

Speaker: oracle
Dialogue: Well, let's have a look at you.

Speaker: oracle
Dialogue: Hmmm.  You sure got the gift, but it's tricky.  I'd say the bad news is, you're not the one.  Still got a lot to learn.  Maybe next life.

Speaker: oracle
Dialogue: Same as the bad news, you're not the one.

Speaker: oracle
Dialogue: You better take a cookie.  Got a big day ahead of you.

Speaker: oracle
Dialogue: Make a believer out of you yet.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: You don't have to tell me anything, Neo, because I already know what she said.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: I brought you so that you could hear it for yourself.  I knew it would help.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: No one will ever ask you because it is a gift from her.  It is for you and you alone.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: Weird.  This area never has this much activity.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Nothing.  Just had a little deja vu.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: What happened?  What did you see?

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: A black cat went past us and then I saw another that looked just like it.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: How much like it?  Was it the same cat?

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: It might have been.  I'm not sure.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: A deja vu is usually a glitch in the Matrix.  It happens when they change something.

Speaker: cable
Dialogue: Did you just feel something weird?

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: That's what they changed.  We're trapped.  There's no way out.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: They'll be able to track it.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Eighth floor.  They're on the eighth floor.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Are orders that hard to follow? I'll say it again.  Morpheus must be taken alive.  Understand?

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: I got him!  I got him!

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: You have to get Neo out. Understand?  That's all that matters now.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: He must get out.  Do you understand me?

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: You all look the same to me.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: I've been waiting for this noment.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Then the others do not matter.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: We gotta find the others.  They're still alive.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: Cypher?  I thought they had you?

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: There was an accident.  A fucking car accident.  All of a sudden. Boom.  They're all dead.  I still got the shakes but, Jesus, someone's going to make a believer out of me.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: Goddamn gas.  My lungs are killing me.

Speaker: dozer
Dialogue: The first aid kit's over here.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: I don't know.  It just went dead.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: An accident?  What about Dozer? Is Dozer there?

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: You know, for a long time, I thought I was in love with you, Trinity.  I used to dream about you...

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: You are a beautiful woman.  Too bad things had to work out like this.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: In a way you're very lucky.  Most people never know why they die. One minute they're alive, the next they're dead.  No warning. Nothing.  That's why I thought maybe I should tell you.  It seemed the least I could do.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: You see, the truth, the real,truth is that the war is over.  It's been over for a long time.  And guess what?  We lost!  Did you hear that?  We lost the war!

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: Zion?  Zion is a part of this delusion.  More of this madness. That's why this has to be done. It has to end.  Now and forever.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Oh rny God.  This is abzut Zion. You gave them Morpheus for the access codes to Zion.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: You see, Trinity, we humans have a place in the future.  But it's not here.  It's in the Matrix.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: Oh, I disagree, Trinity.  I disagree.  I think the Matrix is more real than this world.  I mean, all I do is pull a plug here.  But there, you watch a man die.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: You tell me which is more real.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: Welcome to the real world, right?

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Somehow, some way, you're going to pay for this.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: Pay for it?  I'm not even going to remember it.  It'll be like it never happened.  The tree falling in the forest.  It doesn't make a sound.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: Don't hate me, Trinity.  I'm just the messenger.  And right now I'm going to prove that the message is true.

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: If Morpheus was right, then there's no way I can pull this plug, is there?

Speaker: cypher
Dialogue: If he is the One, then in the next few seconds there has to be some kind of miracle to stop me. Because if he dies like the others that means Morpheus was wrong. How can he be the One if he's dead?

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: How's it feel, Cypher?  Knowing you're about to die?

Speaker: agent jones
Dialogue: There is a problem.  Reagan has failed to secure the hardware.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Never send a human to do a machine's job.

Speaker: agent jones
Dialogue: But if Reagan has failed, why haven't they pulled the plug?

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Haven't you learned by now, that it is impossible to understand why they do the things they do?

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Continue as planned.  Trace his signal to locate their position and deploy an extermination unit.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: What are they doing to him?

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: They inject virus-like serums to break down the system.  It's like cracking a computer.  All it takes is time.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: Depends on the mind.  But eventually, it will crack and his alpha pattern will change from this to this.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: When it does, Morpheus will tell them anything they want to know.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: If an agent got inside Zion's mainframe he could do anything. Disable the defense system. It would be the end of us.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: We can't let that happen.  We have to do it, Trinity.  Zion has to be protected.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: We have to pull the plug.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: We don't have any other choice.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: Morpheus could conform at any minute --

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: If he does I'm sure you'll do what has to be done.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: You saw that place.  It's suicide.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: I know what Morpheus means to you --

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: No.  No, I don't think you do.  If you did, then you would know that I'm not letting him go.  Not without a fight, Tank.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Have you ever stood and stared at it, Morpheus?  Marveled at its beauty.  Its genius.  Billions of people just living out their lives... oblivious.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Did you know that the first Matrix was designed to be a perfect human world?  Where none suffered, where everyone would be happy.  It was a disaster.  No one would accept the program.  Entire crops were lost.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Some believed we lacked the programming language to describe your perfect world.  But I believe that, as a species, human beings define their reality through suffering and misery.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: The perfect world was a dream that your primitive cerebrum kept trying to wake up from.  Which is why the Matrix was re-designed to this:  the peak of your civilization.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: I say 'your civilization' because as soon as we start thinking for you, it really becomes our civilization, which is, of course, what this is all about.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Like the dinosaur.  Look out that window.  You had your time.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: The future is our world, Morpheus. The future is our time.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: What do you think you're doing?

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: You need help.  I'm coming with you.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: No.  No way.  Morpheus sacrificed himself so you could escape. There's no way you're going back in.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Morpheus did what he did because he believed that I'm something that I'm not.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: I'm not the One, Trinity.  The Oracle told me.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: She said I had a gift but I still had a lot to learn.  She told me maybe next life.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Why?  It wouldn't mean anything. He'd still believe what he wanted to believe.  But Morpheus is the one that matters.  He's more important than me and we both know it.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: I may not be what Morpheus thinks I am, but if I don't try to help him, then I'm not even what I think I am.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: I'd like to share a revelation that I've had during my time here. It came to me when I tried to classify your species.  I've realized that you are not actually mammals.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Every mammal on this planet instinctively develops a natural equilibrium with the surrounding environment.  But you humans do not.  You move to an area and you multiply and multiply until every natural resource is consumed and the only way you can survive is to spread to another area.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: There is another organism on this planet that follows the same pattern.  Do you know what it is? A virus.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Human beings are a disease, a cancer of this planet.  You are a plague.  And we are... the cure.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: Okay.  Store's open.  What do you need?

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: No one has ever done anything like this.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: That's why it's going to work.

Speaker: agent brown
Dialogue: Perhaps we are asking the wrong questions.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Of course he knows.  He's resisting.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: I don't know.  If I knew...

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: Hold on, Morpheus.  They're coming for you.  They're coming.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Can you hear me, Morpheus?  I'm going to be honest with you.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: I hate this place.  This zoo. This prison.  This reality, whatever you want to call it, I can't stand it any longer.  It's the smell, if there is such a thing.  I feel saturated by it.  I can taste your stink and every time I do, I fear that I've somehow been infected by it.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: I must get out of here, I must get free.  In this mind is tlie key. My key.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Once Zion is gone, there's no need for me to be here.  Do you understand?  I need the codes.  I have to get inside Zion.  You have to tell me how.

Speaker: agent jones
Dialogue: I think they're trying to save him.

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: I repeat, we are under attack!

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Sir!  Sir!  There was gunfire -- we've lost communication with the roof!

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: But, sir -- the fire -- we should evacuate!

Speaker: agent jones
Dialogue: You will do as you are ordered!

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: He's the One.  He's got to be...

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: I knew it!  I goddamn knew it!

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: Do you believe me now?  He's the One!  Who else could have done this?

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Morpheus, I know you won't believe me but the Oracle told ne I'm not the One.

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: It doesn't matter if I don't believe you --

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: What matters is that you don't believe her.

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: Got one ready.  An underground El station.  State and Balbo.

Speaker: agent brown
Dialogue: The extermination unit is in place.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Get outta here.  Okay?  Run!  Go!

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Morpheus is right, you know.  It doesn't matter what he believes or even what the Oracle believes. What matters is what you believe.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: I want to kiss you too...

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: But I want it to be real.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: An Agent!  You have to send me back!

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: Do you hear that, Mr. Anderson?

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: That is the sound of inevitability.

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: It is the sound of your death.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: You can't use that until Neo is out!

Speaker: morpheus
Dialogue: I know.  Don't worry, he'll make it.

Speaker: neo
Dialogue: Hurry, Tank!  I got some serious pursuit!

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Neo, you better get your ass back here!

Speaker: tank
Dialogue: I'm going to make the call.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: No-no-no!  Neo, you're not dead! You can't be dead!

Speaker: agent smith
Dialogue: I told you, you couldn't win.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: You're right here.  I'm holding you, Neo.  I'm not letting you go. Do you hear me?  I won't let you go.

Speaker: trinity
Dialogue: Goddamnit, Neo!  Don't give it up! Not now!

Speaker: mommy
Dialogue: Don't be silly, honey.  Men don't fly.
